etymologies: late 18th century. From post-classical Latin raphania from classical Latin raphanus + -ia

definitions: A disease occurring in epidemics and characterized by fever, delirium, and seizures or muscle spasms, originally attributed to the contamination of grain with seeds of the wild radish, Raphanus raphanistrum.

notes.text: Raphania is now usually considered to have been a form of ergotism, but has also been identified as a viral encephalitis or encephalomyelitis.
